post_text: Participants are needed to march in the upcoming July 4th parade in support of Arm in Arm’s mission: to promote and to uphold a safe, inclusive climate that values diversity and fosters respect. You would march with flags or signs supporting inclusion in our community and you may represent other cultures through clothing and/or creative expressions. If you have questions or want to help with the organization of this event, please contact Suraiya Suliman at suraiya.suliman@gmail.com

post_text:
Exciting Athletic News:

We want to congratulate our girls cross-country team who ran its way to the MidWach D League Championship last week with a dominating performance at Holden Woods in Shirley. The girls were led by Tessa McClain’s first place finish.

The Maynard-Bromfield football team is undefeated with 8 straight wins as they head into a playoff matchup against Assabet tonight. Kick-off is at 7pm at Maynard High School. The Ayer-Shirley-Bromfield football team brings a 3-5 record into their home game against Quabog tonight at 7:00pm.

After excellent seasons, our girls field hockey team, girls soccer team, and boys soccer team start district tournament play today. Our girls field hockey team plays today in a first round matchup at Monty Tech. The girls soccer team travels to Leicester for a 3:00 contest against the Leicester High School. Finally, the undefeated and league champion boys soccer team will host either Ayer-Shirley or Keefe Tech on Sunday at 2:00. That game will be played at 2:00.
text:
Exciting Athletic News:

We want to congratulate our girls cross-country team who ran its way to the MidWach D League Championship last week with a dominating performance at Holden Woods in Shirley. The girls were led by Tessa McClain’s first place finish.

The Maynard-Bromfield football team is undefeated with 8 straight wins as they head into a playoff matchup against Assabet tonight. Kick-off is at 7pm at Maynard High School. The Ayer-Shirley-Bromfield football team brings a 3-5 record into their home game against Quabog tonight at 7:00pm.

After excellent seasons, our girls field hockey team, girls soccer team, and boys soccer team start district tournament play today. Our girls field hockey team plays today in a first round matchup at Monty Tech. The girls soccer team travels to Leicester for a 3:00 contest against the Leicester High School. Finally, the undefeated and league champion boys soccer team will host either Ayer-Shirley or Keefe Tech on Sunday at 2:00. That game will be played at 2:00.
